snippet: LEAD: More than a decade after they led a revolt against taxes and spending, California voters turned around in elections Tuesday and approved higher gasoline taxes, a looser limit on state spending and more than $4 billion in bonds....
lead_paragraph: LEAD: More than a decade after they led a revolt against taxes and spending, California voters turned around in elections Tuesday and approved higher gasoline taxes, a looser limit on state spending and more than $4 billion in bonds.

headline.main: TAX REVOLT FADES AS CALIFORNIANS VOTE AN INCREASE
